snippet: Beyond employing offline common sense, individuals need to be vigilant about how they use technology and the systems their advisers have to prevent their accounts from being hacked.
abstract: Data breaches at Target and Neiman Marcus were scary, but experts say equally threatening and perhaps more personal attack is a hacker getting into one's email and then using it to take money from bank and brokerage accounts; individuals are urged to be vigilant about using technology and systems in place to prevent accounts from being hacked.
lead_paragraph: Beyond employing offline common sense, individuals need to be vigilant about how they use technology and the systems their advisers have to prevent their accounts from being hacked.

headline.main: Keeping Swindlers Out of Your Bank and Brokerage Accounts
headline.print_headline: Bank and Brokerage Accounts Are Prey to Hackers, Too
